page.title: 01CARTERTON & RAF BRIZE NORTON
page.content: { Carterton }is a fast growing town. Our section includes its shopping and industrial areas and much new housing.The local farms have a rich variety of products. We have examples of beef, dairy and arable farming as well as a large {mushroom unit}and a {racing stables. Black Bourton,} mentioned in the domesday book, has retained its village character despite its proximity to the airfield. {RAF Brize Norton}is probably the predominant feature in our locality. It is the heart of the passenger transport of the RAF and a large number of service families live within Carterton.The landscape reveals flat farmland with hedged fields and few copses.The loss of elms due to disease is still evident.The soil is heavy clay in some regions.Hard stone brash in others.
